The premium fabric, eye-catching hues, rich craftsmanship and gorgeous fits of our collection will make one steal the show, it added.

174.title: PM Modi using child for poll campaign: Cong in complaint to NCPCR
174.article_body: Congress filed a complaint with child rights body NCPCR against PM Narendra Modi, accusing him of using a minor for Gujarat election campaign. BJP had shared a video showing a girl with PM Modi hailing the party's governance. "Have also marked a copy to the Election Commission for violation of the Model Code of Conduct," tweeted Congress leader Supriya Shrinate.

175.title: Nykaa stock falls over 2% a day after CFO announces resignation
175.article_body: A day after Nykaa's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Arvind Agarwal announced his resignation from his position effective November 25, the stock of its parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures was trading over 2% lower on Wednesday. At 10 am, its stock was trading 2.45% lower at ₹170.90 apiece on the BSE.

176.title: One of world's largest cargo plane lands at Mumbai Airport; pics surface
176.article_body: One of the world's largest cargo plane Airbus Beluga Super Transporter made a landing at Mumbai Airport on Tuesday afternoon. It is reportedly one of the heaviest arrivals in Mumbai in the last few years. "Lucky few passengers who witnessed this giant aircraft were left awestruck by the gorgeous sight," said Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport's spokesperson.

177.title: Mumbai Police help 2 Kenyan women get back ₹15 lakh left behind in cab
177.article_body: The Mumbai Police traced a cab and recovered a bag containing ₹15 lakh, which two Kenyan women had forgotten inside the vehicle on Monday evening, police said. The women immediately approached the police and lodged a complaint. With the help of CCTV footage, police managed to get the car’s registration number and later located its driver in the Kalbadevi locality.

178.title: Gujarat BJP suspends 12 more rebels for contesting as independent candidates
178.article_body: BJP has suspended 12 more rebels for contesting as independent candidates after being denied tickets for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. Those suspended include Madhu Shrivastav, Dinu Patel, Dhavalsinh Zala, Kuldipsinh Raul, Khatubhai Pagi, SM Khant, JP Patel, Ramesh Zala, Amarshi Zala, Ramsinh Thakor, Mavji Desai and Lebji Thakor. On Sunday, BJP suspended seven others over the same issue.

179.title: Punjabi actress Nikeet posts video after story about her death posted on her Instagram
179.article_body: Punjabi actress Nikeet Dhillon posted a video after a story about her death was posted on her Instagram account. Nikeet said that her account was hacked, adding, "I did not know how to react to it. How did the person (hacker) even go and do this." "We have a family that gets affected," she said in the video.

180.title: New video shows Satyendar Jain getting 'proper food' in jail after viral massage video
180.article_body: A new CCTV footage from Tihar jail showed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain getting "proper food" in jail, reported ANI. The minister has gained 8 kg of weight while being in jail, contrary to his lawyer's claims of him having lost 28 kgs, said ANI citing Tihar Jail sources. Earlier, videos of the minister getting a massage inside jail went viral.

181.title: It hurts a lot: Argentina striker Lautaro after loss vs Saudi Arabia
181.article_body: Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez said his team's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener "hurts a lot". "We lost...due to our mistakes...We have two finals left," added Lautaro. Reacting to his team's defeat, Argentine winger Angel Di Maria said, "We could [have] easily won 5-0...We knew Saudi Arabia were going to play like that."

182.title: 3 Pune policemen create ruckus at hotel, threaten manager; booked
182.article_body: Three policemen in Pune have been booked for allegedly creating a ruckus at Metro Hotel and threatening the manager. According to the manager, the three forced him to serve them liquor at around 1.15 am, after the place was closed and abused hotel staffers. Following the incident, a senior police officer visited the spot and a case was registered.

183.title: Man burns down property of lover's father after she refuses to elope in Maha
183.article_body: A man, having an extramarital affair, was arrested as he burned down a mini truck and a vegetable shop owned by his girlfriend’s father after she refused to move with him in Nagpur’s Waghoda village in Maharashtra, police said. They were in a relationship for the last seven months due to which his wife left him, police added.

184.title: Slept in 2-3 screenings of 'Taare Zameen Par', was young: Darsheel
184.article_body: 'Taare Zameen Par' actor Darsheel Safary shared that he attended seven screenings of the 2007 release, out of which, he "slept the last two-three times". "I was young...I remember sleeping in one premiere and when I woke up...everyone...was crying. It was gloomiest atmosphere possible," he recalled. He said, at the age of 25, he understood why the film was loved.

185.title: B2B startup Soptle raises $300,000 from Kube VC, Dunzo Co-founder
185.article_body: Soptle, B2B retail commerce startup, has secured $300,000 in an angel round led by early-stage venture capital firms Kube VC and Soonicorn LLP. Other angel investors including Dunzo Co-founder Ankur Agarwal, Fitso Co-founder Saurabh Aggarwal and Gati CEO Pirojshaw Sarkari also participated in the funding round. The startup, founded by Pravas Chandragiri, had raised an undisclosed amount in August.

186.title: Inox Green Energy Services to make its market debut today
186.article_body: Inox Green Energy Services, the wind power operation and maintenance service provider, is going to make its stock market debut on Wednesday. The company's initial public offering to raise ₹740 crore, which started on November 11 and concluded on November 15, was subscribed 1.6 times. The issue price of the IPO was ₹61-₹65 per share.

187.title: Musk cuts home internet, daycare allowance & other perks for Twitter staff: Report
187.article_body: Elon Musk has cut perks such as home internet and daycare allowance for Twitter employees, as per a report. The report, citing an internal memo, said perks being discontinued include team activities, all costs associated with "wellness," "productivity," and "new hire productivity". Musk said that "allowances will be reevaluated over time and may be added back when company's situation improves".

188.title: Truck driver accused in 48 car-pileup incident in Pune gets bail
188.article_body: A court has granted bail to the truck driver who is accused in the 48 car-pileup incident on Pune's Navale bridge on Tuesday. Meanwhile, a police officer said that the police are trying to piece together the sequence of events and technical aspects of the accident. The cleaner who was booked for aiding the truck driver was also granted bail.

189.title: Construction of Bengaluru airport Terminal 3 to start after 10 yrs: Fairfax
189.article_body: The construction of Terminal 3 of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) has been delayed until BIAL's (Bangalore International Airport Limited's) fiscal year 2034, Fairfax India said. BIAL is responsible for operating the KIA airport and Fairfax India owns a 54 percent stake in the company. Fairfax said this while announcing its third quarter financial results.

190.title: We need players who can run: Burnley coach Kompany on signing Ronaldo
190.article_body: Talking about Burnley potentially signing Cristiano Ronaldo after his Manchester United exit, ex-Manchester City captain and Burnley manager Vincent Kompany said, "We need players who can run." Discussing Ronaldo's exit, Kompany added, "Everybody loses apart from...the Manchester United manager." Ronaldo had earlier stated that he turned down a €350-million offer from a team in Saudi Arabia.

191.title: Ground situation is alarming, need election commission chief who can't be bulldozed: SC
191.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that successive governments have destroyed the independence of the Election Commission of India by ensuring no Chief Election Commissioner gets the full six-year term. The court said, "Situation on the ground is fairly alarming". A Chief Election Commissioner should be someone "with character" who "does not allow himself to be bulldozed", the court added.

192.title: HP to lay off 4,000-6,000 employees globally over next 3 years
192.article_body: Computer maker HP has said that it plans to cut 4,000 to 6,000 employees globally over the next three years. In a statement, HP said its ‘Future Ready Transformation plan' should result in annualized gross run rate savings of $1.4 billion or more in the next three years, with around $1 billion in costs including restructuring.

193.title: 20-year-old man fights off leopard with stick in Thane
193.article_body: A 20-year-old man reportedly fought off a leopard using a stick near Vihigaon village of Thane district on Monday afternoon. More, who fought the animal for over 10 minutes, said, "I was holding a bunch of sticks…Then I caught hold of a bigger stick and managed to keep the big cat at bay." He suffered deep scratches on his back.

194.title: Manchester United's American owners consider selling club
194.article_body: Manchester United on Tuesday said it was starting a process to explore strategic alternatives, including a new investment or a potential sale, 17 years after the American Glazer family bought the club. The Glazer family is working with financial advisers on the process, which could lead to a partial sale of the club or investments including stadium and infrastructure redevelopment.

195.title: I prefer Hindi cinema: Pankaj on rejecting Telugu, Malayalam films
195.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi shared that he has rejected offers from Telugu and Malayalam filmmakers because he feels he wouldn't be able to do justice to those films. He added that while he "prefers" and feels comfortable in Hindi cinema, he's open to working in other languages, including Hollywood, if "someone can write a Hindi-speaking character" for him.

196.title: Cyberabad Police to auction 504 abandoned, unclaimed vehicles
196.article_body: The Cyberabad Police will auction 504 abandoned or unclaimed vehicles of various types pooled at Moinabad police station grounds. The police have directed people who might have any objection or interest in relation to any of these vehicles to file an application before the police station SHO concerned and claim the vehicle within a period of six months.

197.title: Disney CEO Iger could be asked to identify his successor again: Report
197.article_body: Bob Iger, who has been named the CEO of The Walt Disney Company for the next two years, could be asked to pick his successor, Reuters reported. Part of his mandate, according to Disney, is to work with the board to develop a successor. Iger, 71, was the Disney CEO for 15 years previously and postponed his retirement four times.

198.title: Martin Guptill gives up his New Zealand central contract
198.article_body: Opener Martin Guptill has given up his New Zealand central contract. The New Zealand Cricket stated it agreed to release Guptill from his central contract so he can pursue playing opportunities elsewhere. Guptill was a part of New Zealand's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, but didn't feature in any match. The 36-year-old is the third-highest T20I run-scorer with 3,531 runs.

199.title: Little concerned about bringing up my child in public eye: Alia
199.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she's "a little concerned" about bringing up her child in the public eye. She said it's something that she feels "very protective about". "I talk about it with my friends, with my family, and my husband (Ranbir Kapoor) a lot. I don't want there to be a, sort of, intrusion into my child's life," she added.

200.title: Vehicle rams into school van in Gr Noida; 7-year-old girl injured
200.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was injured after a vehicle rammed into a school bus in Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. A police spokesperson said that the girl was taken to a hospital after her parents reached the spot and her condition is stable now. Six to seven children were on board the school van, the police spokesperson added.

201.title: 4-day-old baby girl found abandoned on footpath in Mumbai
201.article_body: A four-day-old baby girl was found abandoned on a footpath in Mumbai's Borivali West by police on Monday. The officers were on patrol duty when they heard a baby crying. The girl, wrapped in a thin blanket, was rushed to a hospital. "The baby girl was cold but did not have any injury marks on her body," said an officer.

202.title: Female tourist dances on sacred pyramid as locals throw bottles at her in Mexico
202.article_body: A female tourist in Mexico was attacked by locals for climbing a sacred pyramid. In a video shared on social media, the woman is seen dancing on the sacred site as locals threw bottles at her as part of their protest. She was later brought down by a security official present at the site.

203.title: Defending champions France defeat Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener
203.article_body: Defending champions France defeated Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener at Al Janoub Stadium in Al Wakrah. Olivier Giroud scored a brace in the match and equalled Thierry Henry's record for scoring most goals for France (51). Giroud, aged 36 years and 53 days, also became the oldest footballer to play for France in World Cup history.

204.title: Sam Bankman-Fried ran FTX as his 'personal fiefdom', court hears
204.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX was run as the "personal fiefdom" of 30-year-old ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, lawyers representing FTX told a US bankruptcy court on Tuesday. They said FTX spent $300 million on real estate in the Bahamas for the use of its executives. "FTX was in the control of...unsophisticated individuals. Some or all of them were compromised," a lawyer said.

205.title: My love for Manchester United will never change: Ronaldo after exit from club
205.article_body: Releasing a statement after Manchester United announced that he will be leaving the club with immediate effect, Portuguese forward Cristiano Ronaldo said, "I love Manchester United and I love the fans, that will never ever change." He added, "However, it feels like the right time for me to seek a new challenge. I wish the team every success."

206.title: Criminal proceedings begin against Imran Khan in Toshakhana case
206.article_body: Criminal proceedings began against former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday in the Toshakhana gifts case. Khan is accused of "deliberately" concealing "his assets relating to Toshakhana gifts retained by him, particularly in years 2018 and 2019". The Toshakhana is a Pakistani government department that stores gifts given to lawmakers and senior officials by foreign governments.

207.title: UK businesses must reduce dependence on cheap labour: Keir Starmer
207.article_body: UK's Opposition Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer on Tuesday said businesses in Britain must reduce dependency on cheap, migrant labour. At a business leaders summit, he said more investments should be made to train workers "who are already here". He said firms must put forth a plan on how they intend to develop the skills of British workers.

208.title: Tribals in T'gana hack official to death for opposing felling of trees
208.article_body: A 47-year-old forest official was hacked to death by a group of tribals in Telangana's Bhadradri Kothagudem when he tried to stop them from felling a tree plantation to take up 'podu cultivation'. The official, Chalamala Srinivas Rao, had gone to Bendalapadu area with a team of forest officials. "Tribals resisted and this led to a confrontation," police said.

209.title: Cristiano Ronaldo leaves Manchester United with immediate effect
209.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has left Manchester United by mutual agreement with immediate effect, the club announced. This comes after his interview wherein he criticised Manchester United and claimed he's being forced out of the club. "Everyone at Manchester United remains focused on continuing...team’s progress under Erik ten Hag and working together to deliver success on the pitch," the club said.

210.title: Musk asks if his tweets are considered 'work', Twitter users react
210.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "Wait, if I tweet, does that count as work?" Reacting to this, a Twitter user said, "I'm guessing your Tesla shareholders, who're losing their shirts as [Tesla's] stock continues to make multi-year lows...might not think that you tweeting counts as work." Another user tweeted, "You're promoting your business, so it is work."

211.title: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni dies at 67
211.article_body: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni died on Tuesday at the age of 67 after a spell of illness. Maroni was a longtime leader of the right-wing Northern League party. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said Maroni had served Italy with "good sense and concreteness". Maroni served as the country's interior minister twice (1994-1995 and 2008-2011) and labour minister (2001) once.

212.title: Mexican Navy finds boat loaded with 10 tons of methamphetamines
212.article_body: The Mexican Navy on Tuesday said a patrol team found a shrimp boat loaded with approximately 10 tons of banned drug methamphetamines off its western Pacific coast. The boat was detected last week, said Navy Secretary Jose Rafael Ojeda. When the marine officials approached the vessel, its crew reportedly tried to sink the boat, he said.

213.title: Jadeja unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test, ODI series in Dec: Reports
213.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is reportedly unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test and ODI series in December. According to reports, Jadeja, who has been sidelined owing to an injury since this year's Asia Cup, is yet to fully recover. Notably, the Bangladesh tour, which consists of three ODIs and two Tests, will conclude by December 26.

214.title: Haven't seen son in 3 yrs: Mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect
214.article_body: The mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect Abdul Mateen Taha claimed that she hasn't seen her son in three years since he went missing from Bengaluru. She added that she hasn't seen him since he attained his engineering degree three years ago. His mother also said that if her son has done anything wrong, she wants him to be punished.

215.title: Maoists torch vehicles used for J'khand railway line construction
215.article_body: Maoists on Tuesday set ablaze around a dozen vehicles used for the construction of a railway line in Jharkhand's Latehar district, police said. In October, maoists had shot at three people in a village and asked railway line construction workers to refrain from work until levy was paid. A private construction firm is engaged in laying the 195-km-long railway line.

216.title: Centre approves ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in UP
216.article_body: The Centre approved ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in Uttar Pradesh under the Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana. According to a government spokesperson, the houses will be ready by March 2024. The spokesperson added that in the last five years, 27 lakh houses have been built under the scheme and 26 lakh were handed over to the beneficiaries.

217.title: 100 Indian pilgrims arrive in Pak for Hindu saint's birth anniversary
217.article_body: Around 100 Indian pilgrims arrived in Pakistan on Tuesday to attend the celebrations of the 314th birth anniversary of Hindu saint Satguru Shadaram Sahib in Sindh province. The pilgrims entered Pakistan via the Wagah border crossing, a Pakistani official said. The pilgrims will visit the historic Shadani Darbar temple, among other holy sites, he added.

218.title: Bank deposits of Kerala college seized for 'cheating parents'
218.article_body: The bank deposits of Dr SM CSI Medical College in Thiruvananthapuram district, Kerala, worth ₹95.25 lakh have been attached under the anti-money laundering law, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Tuesday. The ED alleged the college authorities cheated parents by taking money from them and promising admission to their children. "However, admissions were not given," the ED said.

219.title: Enjoying batting, expressing myself: Suryakumar on 'Player of the Series' award
219.article_body: After winning 'Player of the Series' award in three-match T20I series against New Zealand, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said he's enjoying his batting. "Just going there and expressing myself. Not carrying any baggage out there," he added. Suryakumar scored 124 runs in two innings, which includes a century he scored in second T20I to help India take a 1-0 lead.

220.title: Kejriwal's electricity model is reason for rising unemployment in Delhi: Cong
220.article_body: Congress leader Ajay Maken alleged that CM Arvind Kejriwal's electricity model is the reason for the rising unemployment in Delhi. "Delhi government gives money directly to private companies without audit. Instead of providing ₹14,731 crore as a power subsidy to consumers, it is being given directly to private companies," Maken said. Notably, Delhi civic polls will be held next month.

221.title: Gujarat CM is a 'puppet', can't even change his own peon: Kejriwal
221.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that Bhupendra Patel is a "puppet Chief Minister" of Gujarat and "doesn't even have the authority to change his own peon". Speaking for AAP's chief ministerial candidate in Gujarat, Isudan Gadhvi, he asked people if they wanted a 'puppet CM' or an educated CM. Kejriwal further said that Gadhvi's heart "beats for the poor".

222.title: LeT terror module busted in J&K, 4 arrested: Police
222.article_body: A Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terror module was busted in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district on Tuesday, police said. Two active terrorists and two of their associates, including a woman, were arrested by security personnel after the operation. A huge cache of arms and ammunition and materials to make an improvised explosive device (IED) were also recovered.

223.title: Amazon summoned by Labour Ministry over alleged violations in layoffs
223.article_body: Labour Ministry has summoned Amazon India's public policy manager on November 23 following a complaint by the employee union Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) alleging violation of labour laws. NITES has alleged that Amazon is forcing employees to quit the company and has sought an inquiry. Amazon has confirmed starting layoffs, which could reportedly affect 10,000 employees.

224.title: Some fans want to kill our players: Iran manager Carlos Queiroz
224.article_body: Referring to some Iranian fans criticising their national team players for not singing National Anthem during their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Iran manager Carlos Queiroz said, "Whatever [the players] do, whatever they say, [some fans] want to kill them." He added, "The fans who aren't ready to support the team should stay home."

225.title: Aaditya Thackeray to meet Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday
225.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Aaditya Thackeray will meet Bihar Deputy Chief Minister and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav in Patna on Wednesday. The Maharashtra MLA will be accompanied by Rajya Sabha MPs Anil Desai, Priyanka Chaturvedi and other leaders. "It'll be a courtesy meeting," the party said. Earlier this year, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar broke ties with the BJP.

226.title: Army ready to execute order to take back PoK: Northern Command chief
226.article_body: Northern Command chief Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi said the Indian Army is ready to execute the order to take back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). "If (the ceasefire is) broken at any time, we will give them a befitting reply," said L-G Dwivedi. Earlier, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said all PoK refugees in India will get their land and homes back.

227.title: Hooda hesitated on preferred batting slot, should say 'I'll replace Kohli': Kaif
227.article_body: Mohammad Kaif said India all-rounder Deepak Hooda shouldn't have "hesitated" when he was asked about his preferred batting position ahead of third T20I against New Zealand. "He should say, 'I want to bat higher up the order...want to play in place of KL Rahul. I'll replace Virat Kohli'," added Kaif. Hooda had said I'd like to bat at number five.

228.title: PhonePe raises ₹742 crore from Singapore-based parent: Report
228.article_body: Flipkart-owned digital payments platform PhonePe has reportedly received a fresh capital infusion of about ₹742 crore from its Singapore-registered parent entity PhonePe Pvt Ltd. In a regulatory filing, the Walmart-backed company’s board passed a resolution to allot a total of 3,71,753 equity shares at ₹19,968 apiece. PhonePe also reported a standalone revenue of ₹1,640 crore for FY22.

229.title: India criticises N Korea in UN for missile launch, says 'it impacts peace, security'
229.article_body: India has condemned the launch of the recent intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) by the North Korean regime during a UN Security Council (UNSC) meeting. "Proliferation of nuclear & missile technologies is a matter of concern, as they have an adverse impact on peace & security in the region, including on India," said India's Permanent Representative at the UNSC Ruchira Kamboj.

230.title: How many jobs have they given: Tejashwi criticises PM Modi over Rozgar Mela
230.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi distributed 71,056 appointment letters through the 'Rozgar Mela' event, Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav asked, "How many jobs are they (BJP government) giving to the people of this country?" The RJD leader added, "Despite providing appointment letters, the BJP-led central government has been unable to provide jobs to the country's youth."

231.title: TRS MLA grabs govt official's collar for inaugurating school before his arrival
231.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing TRS MLA from Telangana's Gadwal, Bandla Krishna Mohan Reddy, grabbing a government official by his collar for inaugurating a school before Reddy arrived for the event. Reddy held the official's collar and pushed him as he was angered by some remark made by the official. He later clarified that he didn't attack anyone deliberately.

232.title: Denied ticket for Gujarat polls, ex-Congress MLA Rathod joins BJP
232.article_body: Former Congress MLA Kaminiba Rathod on Tuesday resigned from the party and joined the BJP in Gujarat. This comes after Congress denied her a ticket for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Notably, she had also accused Congress of selling tickets for cash. She had claimed that a middleman had sought ₹1 crore from her for a ticket.

233.title: 6 killed, 4 hurt as lorry rams into mini-van in Andhra Pradesh
233.article_body: Six persons were killed after a speeding lorry rammed into a passenger mini-van in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitarama Raju district near the Telangana border on Tuesday. All the victims were from Chhattisgarh and were travelling in the mini-van. They were returning after visiting the Lord Rama temple in Bhadrachalam in Telangana.

234.title: Sunny Deol had a massive ego, didn't return signing amount of incomplete film: Suneel
234.article_body: Suneel Darshan, speaking about his legal feud with actor Sunny Deol that has continued for over 25 years, accused Sunny of having a "massive ego". He had alleged that Sunny left the film 'Ajay' incomplete and refused to shoot the ending. "First, he promised to return the money. Then he said he had no money...he fooled me," said Suneel.

235.title: This is false: Meta on reports of Mark Zuckerberg resigning as CEO next year
235.article_body: Facebook parent company Meta has denied reports that claimed that CEO Mark Zuckerberg will be stepping down from his role next year. "This is false," Meta spokesperson Andy Stone said in a tweet on Tuesday. News website The Leak had reported that Zuckerberg was set to resign in 2023, which briefly sent the company's shares up 1%.

236.title: AAP turned Tihar into Thailand: BJP on Satyendar Jain's massage
236.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia were aware of AAP minister Satyendar Jain getting a massage in jail. "Kejriwal must tell us how Tihar has been transformed into Thailand," said Poonawalla. He added that the AAP was "fooling" people by claiming the massage was "physiotherapy being done by a rapist".

237.title: PM Modi distributing job letters is an election stunt: Congress
237.article_body: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi handing out job letters to youths was an "election stunt". Earlier in the day, PM Modi handed out over 71,000 job letters to youths across the country via video conference. Kharge reminded the BJP government that it had promised 2 crore jobs every year.

238.title: 10 Chadian soldiers killed in Boko Haram attack near Nigeria border
238.article_body: At least 10 soldiers were killed in an attack on a Chadian military unit by Boko Haram militants in the Lake Chad region near the Nigerian border on Tuesday, Chad's government said. Several others were wounded in the attack on the island of Bouka-Toullorom. The Boko Haram insurgency, which erupted in northeast Nigeria in 2009, has killed over 3,50,000 people.

239.title: India among fastest growing Asian economies amid global slowdown: OECD
239.article_body: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) said India is among the fastest growing economies in Asia amid a global slowdown. OECD added India is set to be the second-fastest growing G20 economy in FY 2022-23 behind Saudi Arabia. "[India's] GDP growth is expected to slow...to 5.7% in FY 2023-24, before reverting to around 7% in FY 2024-25," OECD said.

240.title: Which companies have seen an ex-CEO return to the company besides Disney?
240.article_body: Disney's Bob Iger has returned to the company as CEO less than a year after his retirement. In 2000, Paul Allaire returned as Xerox CEO, and in 2013, AG Lafley returned as P&G's CEO. Steve Jobs returned as Apple's CEO in 1997 after the company was near collapse and remade it into the world's most-valued company by 2011.

241.title: Will miss Akshay Kumar in 'Hera Pheri 3': Suniel Shetty
241.article_body: Suniel Shetty said he was surprised after knowing about Akshay Kumar's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3'. When asked if he'll miss Akshay in the third part, Suniel said, "Of course, I will and that was the intention that Raju, Shyam and Babu Rao should be together." While Suniel plays the role of Shyam, Babu Rao is played by Paresh Rawal.

242.title: We have no fear & nothing to lose, we'll be 100%: Canada football coach
242.article_body: Canada coach John Herdman said the team will head into their 2022 FIFA World Cup match against Belgium with nothing to lose. “It’s exciting times now, the dark clouds have shifted...we will all be 100%,” said Herdman. He added that it had been a great, “gritty and resilient” journey to reach the tournament and there are no “elements” of fear.

243.title: Lewis Hamilton made me push my limits this year: Mercedes F1's Russell
243.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver George Russell said teammate and seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton made him push his "limits as a driver". "I've learned a huge amount going up against somebody like him in the same car...There is no better reference," he said. Russell added that he has no doubts that Hamilton will be "back to his normal level next year".

244.title: Twitter calls lawsuit over layoffs 'baseless', says it delayed severance pay
244.article_body: Twitter has told a US federal judge that a lawsuit claiming it violated law by laying off thousands of workers without notice is "baseless". Twitter added that it met its legal obligations by informing workers that their last day would be January 4, or after 60 days. The company said the lawsuit had only caused confusion and delayed severance payments.

245.title: JSW Energy seeks shareholders' nod to appoint Parth Jindal as director
245.article_body: JSW Energy has sought shareholders' approval to appoint Parth Jindal as a Director on the company's board. The remote e-voting process for the resolution will start on November 23 and end on December 22. Parth Jindal, the son of the company's Chairman and Managing Director, Sajjan Jindal, was appointed as an additional director with effect from October 28.

246.title: 300 terrorists present in J&K, 160 waiting to enter: Army commander
246.article_body: Northern Command chief Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi said around 300 terrorists are currently in J&K, while 160 others are waiting to sneak in from Pakistan. He added that the security situation in the Union Territory has undergone a major change after the abrogation of Article 370. "Today, peace and development have taken the center stage," said Lieutenant General Dwivedi.

247.title: Man jailed for 6 months for letting cows roam on streets in Gujarat
247.article_body: A man has been sentenced to six months in jail for endangering people's lives by letting his cows roam on streets in Gujarat in 2019. Prakash Jairam Desai also received a two-year jail sentence for threatening members of an Amdavad Municipal Corporation team, who had gone to impound the animals. The team had found five animals roaming near Shantipur Chhapra.

248.title: Dog found carrying newborn's body in mouth inside hospital in Jaipur
248.article_body: A dog was found roaming inside the Mahila Chikitsalaya in Rajasthan's Jaipur with a newborn's body clutched in its mouth. Hospital staff took on the dog, forcing it to run away and leave the body behind. "We're unsure if the infant was born inside our hospital," said hospital superintendent Dr Asha Verma. Police have initiated a probe into the matter.

249.title: 135-year-old message in a bottle found under floor of UK home, pics surface
249.article_body: A plumber in UK's Scotland found a message in a whisky bottle, dating back to 1887, underneath the floorboards of a house. The message said, "James Ritchie and John Grieve laid this floor but they did not drink the whisky...Whoever finds this bottle may think our dust is blowing along the road." The home's owner shared pictures of the find.

250.title: 3 policemen injured in stone-pelting during protest in Chhattisgarh
250.article_body: Three policemen were injured when an agitation for a paddy procurement centre turned violent in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband district, an official said on Tuesday. The residents of Kandekela village had been demanding that the paddy procurement centre, located in Bhejipadar, be shifted to their village, he added. Protesters had allegedly pelted stones, following which some vehicles were also damaged.

251.title: Saudi Arabia manager thanks Crown Prince after defeating Argentina 2-1
251.article_body: Saudi Arabia manager Herve Renard thanked Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for his support to the team after they beat Argentina 2-1 in a 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match. "When we met with...Prince, he did not put any pressure on us," said Renard. He added that the team had made "history" and "it will stay" with them forever.

252.title: I'd like to bat at 5, we've legend playing at 3, I've to be realistic: Hooda
252.article_body: When asked about his preferred batting position in Team India, all-rounder Deepak Hooda said, "I'd like to bat at five, we've a legend playing at three...I've to be realistic, I can't get that spot." Batting at number six in second T20I against New Zealand, Deepak Hooda was dismissed for a duck. This was his second consecutive score of 0.

253.title: K'taka Police alert about terror activities: Bommai on Mangaluru blast
253.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that the Karnataka Police are alert about terror activities. "The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has initiated measures to track...movements of terror organisations, be it international or national, which is behind the Mangaluru blast suspect. We've have taken this case...seriously," he said. Police have busted 18 terror sleeper cells, he added.

254.title: BNP Paribas Arbitrage sells Wipro's shares worth ₹186 crore
254.article_body: BNP Paribas Arbitrage on Tuesday offloaded shares of IT company Wipro for ₹185.76 crore through the open market transactions. According to official data with the BSE, BNP Paribas Arbitrage sold 48,00,000 shares of the company in two tranches. Meanwhile, French financial services company Societe Generale acquired the company's shares at ₹387 per piece.

255.title: Saudi Arabia declares national holiday tomorrow to celebrate win over Argentina in FIFA WC
255.article_body: Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz has declared Wednesday a national holiday to celebrate the country's victory over Argentina in 2022 FIFA World Cup. Saudi Arabia defeated Argentina 2-1 in their opening match on Tuesday. Saudi Arabia scored two goals within five minutes of each other in the second half after trailing 0-1 in the first half.

256.title: May all your dreams come true: Sara on ex-boyfriend Kartik's b'day
256.article_body: Sara Ali Khan took to her Instagram Stories on Tuesday to wish Kartik Aaryan on his birthday. "Happiest birthday @kartikaaryan...Hope this year is all that you've hoped for and may all your dreams continue coming true," she wrote. Sara and Kartik once dated each other and later parted ways, as confirmed by Karan Johar on his show 'Koffee With Karan'.

257.title: Prankster impersonating Macron spoke to Polish Prez after missile mishap
257.article_body: Poland's President Andrzej Duda spoke to a hoax caller after a suspected Ukrainian stray missile hit a Polish village near the Ukrainian border, Duda's office confirmed on Tuesday. Russian comedians Vovan and Lexus have posted a recording of the call on the internet. This was the second instance in recent years where the pranksters managed to get through to Duda.

258.title: Avatar 2 is f*****g expensive, needs to make $2 bn to be profitable: Cameron
258.article_body: Filmmaker James Cameron has said that his upcoming film 'Avatar: The Way of Water' is "very f*****g" expensive. He added that the film will have to be the third or fourth highest-grossing film in the world in order to make a profit. 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' is the fourth-highest film currently with $2.07 billion.

259.title: FTX has cash balance of $1.24 bn, owes at least $3.1 bn: Filing
259.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX and its affiliates have a combined cash balance of $1.24 billion as of November 20, as per its new bankruptcy filing. According to a Bloomberg report, trading firm Alameda Research's cash balance stood at $401 million, while FTX Japan had $171.7 million. FTX had previously said that it owes its 50 biggest creditors nearly $3.1 billion.

260.title: Dubai airport saw more passengers than pre-COVID-19 era: Official
260.article_body: The passenger numbers at the Dubai International Airport (DXB) have surpassed pre-coronavirus pandemic levels in this year's third quarter, said an airport executive. The airport recorded 18.5 million passengers in the third quarter of 2022, which was 17.8 million passengers in 2020's first quarter. Accordingly, the airport's annual forecast has also been revised by another 1 million passengers.

261.title: Adani Enterprises plans to raise $1.8 billion: Report
261.article_body: Adani Enterprises is reportedly planning to raise $1.8 billion via a further public offering or preferential allotment. Gautam Adani's conglomerate is working with advisers on the follow-on issue and could sell the shares as soon as next year. The company's board will meet on November 25 to discuss raising funds, it said in an exchange filing on Tuesday.

262.title: Cinema down South was always much better than Bollywood: Tigmanshu
262.article_body: Filmmaker Tigmanshu Dhulia has said that cinema in South India was "always" better than Bollywood. "Telugu films used to be a bit over the top but Malayalam and Tamil used to be very good. So, was cinema in Bengal," he added. Tigmanshu stated, "Hindi audience lapped cinema when Southern industry started making multi-lingual films."

263.title: Chemicals linked to cancer, diabetes found in sanitary napkins in India: Study
263.article_body: High amounts of harmful chemicals are present in popular sanitary napkins sold in India, a study published in a report titled 'Menstrual Waste 2022' stated. The study by a Delhi-based NGO found phthalates in 10 samples of sanitary napkins available in the market. Exposure to phthalates has been linked to heart and reproductive system disorders, diabetes, and cancers, among others.

264.title: Siraj's pace is an asset, he'll succeed everywhere around the world: Taylor
264.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Ross Taylor has said Mohammed Siraj's "pace is an asset" after the India pacer finished as the leading wicket-taker in India-New Zealand T20I series. "You need those bowlers who can bowl 140 plus...he's going to succeed everywhere around the world and not just on wickets that bounce," he added. Siraj took total six wickets in three-match series.

265.title: Indian biologist gets UN's highest honour for saving endangered storks
265.article_body: Wildlife biologist Purnima Devi Barman is among the honourees of the UN Environment Programme's (UNEP) Champions of the Earth award 2022 in the Entrepreneurial Vision category. Barman leads the 'Hargila Army', an all-female grassroots conservation movement dedicated to protecting the Greater Adjutant stork from extinction. "Barman's...conservation work has empowered thousands of women," UNEP said.

266.title: Arittapatti village notified as Tamil Nadu's first biodiversity heritage site
266.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has declared Arittapatti village in Madurai as the state's first biodiversity heritage site. The village is surrounded by a chain of seven barren granite hillocks that act as a watershed and support close to 72 lakes, 200 natural spring pools and three check dams. The village also hosts around 250 bird species, including three flagship raptor species.

267.title: Sushant showed everyone how a TV actor could transition into films: Sharad
267.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar said in an interview that late actor Sushant Singh Rajput showed everyone how a TV actor could transition into films. "Hats off to him...he proved it...He set an example for everyone," Sharad added. He further said Sushant did "some excellent work" in television and films. "He always wanted to do...something great, and he achieved that," said Sharad.

268.title: We lost due to 5 minutes of mistakes: Messi on Argentina's loss vs Saudi Arabia
268.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi said he did not expect to start 2022 FIFA World Cup with a loss to Saudi Arabia. "It's a situation that this group of players have never been through...in five minutes of mistakes...we went 1-2 down," he said. Messi added that the Saudi team "did not surprise" as he knew "they could do that".

269.title: Hindu Mahasabha to rename Meerut after Godse if elected to power
269.article_body: Hindu Mahasabha on Tuesday said it will rename Meerut as Nathuram Godse Nagar if its candidate is elected as the Mayor in the upcoming municipal polls. Abhishek Agarwal, Hindu Mahasabha's new chief of Meerut district for the urban body elections, said that the first promise is to make India a "Hindu Rashtra", adding that patriotic candidates will be identified.

270.title: More Aftab-Shraddha too, India needs strict anti-jihad laws: Assam CM
270.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said that India needs strict 'anti-jihad' laws while referring to the murder of Shraddha Walkar, who was killed by her live-in partner in Delhi. "When police asked why he brought only Hindu girls, he said he did it because they are emotional," Sarma said, adding that only BJP could end forced religious conversions.

271.title: Zorba, India's first dog to be deployed for tracking down poachers, dies
271.article_body: Zorba, India's first dog to be deployed for tracking down poachers, died in Guwahati, Assam due to old age. The 12-year-old male Belgian Malinois was a member of 'K9', the nation's first dog squad for wildlife crimes. With an 8-year career covering several rhino protection areas in Assam, Zorba was actively engaged in anti-poaching operations.

272.title: One word, Surya: Zaheer on positives for India from T20I series vs NZ
272.article_body: On being asked to pick positives for India in the T20I series against New Zealand, Zaheer Khan said, "One word: Suryakumar Yadav." "The way Surya was batting was too good, destructive...This was the last T20I in...calendar year and he has scored close to 1,200 runs in the whole season," he added. Suryakumar scored 111* and 13 in the three-match series.

273.title: Won't let Pakistan smuggle weapons, drugs into India: Lt Gen Dwivedi
273.article_body: Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi on Tuesday said that Pakistan is trying to smuggle pistols, grenades and drugs into India to create small incidents of unrest in the country. "We'll not let [this] happen," the General Officer-Commanding-in-Chief of Northern Command added. He stated that the Indian Army will always be ready to execute government orders like taking back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

274.title: 5.86 lakh differently-abled persons in K'taka given UDID cards: Minister
274.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar on Tuesday said the state has distributed 5.86 lakh Unique Disability Identification Cards (UDID). "Ramanagara district has the highest number of cards distributed, followed by Chikkamagaluru, Bagalkote, Haveri, Uttara Kannada, Belagavi and Mandya districts," Sudhakar said. He further urged people with disabilities to register their names on the UDID portal.

275.title: Law & order in northeast improved after Modi govt came to power: Tripura CM
275.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Tuesday said that the law and order situation of the northeastern states has improved significantly under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi. "The government has adopted a 'Zero Tolerance' policy to deal with crimes," Saha said. He added that interstate issues have also been resolved with the efforts of the Modi government.

276.title: What records did India break in T20I cricket in 2022?
276.article_body: India played a total of 40 T20Is this year, the most by any team in a calendar year. India recorded most T20I wins in a calendar year (28). Suryakumar Yadav broke the record for slamming most sixes in a calendar year (68). Further, Rohit Sharma broke the record for winning most T20Is as captain in a year (21).

277.title: Today is a sad day: Argentina manager on team's 1-2 loss to Saudi Arabia
277.article_body: Speaking after Argentina's 1-2 loss to 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in their first match in FIFA World Cup 2022 on Tuesday, Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni stated, "Today is a sad day but as we always say, chin up and keep going." Saudi Arabia scored both their goals in second half after Argentina captain Lionel Messi scored via penalty in the 10th-minute.

278.title: Major UK swimming pool operator cuts opening hours to save energy costs
278.article_body: A major British swimming pool operator has announced a reduction in its opening hours in wake of the high energy bills affecting households and businesses across Europe. Over 200 leisure centres and swimming pools across Britain will remain open for two hours less than usual on certain days to save on heating and lighting costs, said Greenwich Leisure Limited (GLL).

279.title: 5 bacteria types caused 6.8 lakh deaths in India in 2019: Lancet study
279.article_body: Five bacteria types — E. coli, S. pneumoniae, K. pneumoniae, S. aureus and A. baumannii — caused nearly 6.8 lakh deaths in India in 2019, according to a study published in The Lancet journal. E. Coli was the most deadly pathogen, claiming 1.57 lakh lives in India in 2019. Common bacterial infections were linked to one in eight deaths globally.

280.title: I will attend the FIFA World Cup final in Qatar: Varun Dhawan
280.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said that he'll be going to Qatar to attend the final of the FIFA World Cup. When asked to choose between Argentina and Brazil, Varun stated, "I hope Brazil gets in over Argentina. Actually, Argentina aur Brazil mereko dono chalega (I don't really mind either of them winning)." The final will be played on December 18.

281.title: I'm in touch with Charu, I send her nice WhatsApp messages: Rajeev Sen
281.article_body: Actor Rajeev Sen shared a video on his YouTube channel where he said that he's in touch with his estranged wife Charu Asopa, adding that he keeps sending her nice WhatsApp messages. "I try to be nice to her...Making her feel that yes, I'm there, even though we are not physically there with each other," he added.

282.title: Telangana forest officer killed in attack by tribals grazing cattle
282.article_body: A forest officer in Telangana died after he was attacked by two men armed with axes while he was trying to evict tribals illegally grazing cattle on forest plantations on Tuesday. Srinivas Rao was the recipient of KVS Babu Gold Medal for forest protection in his range in 2021. CM K Chandrashekar Rao announced an ex-gratia payment of ₹50 lakh.

283.title: Would love to collaborate with Kartik for 'Pyaar Ka...': Divyenndu
283.article_body: Actor Divyenndu has refuted reports stating he'll reunite with actor Kartik Aaryan for 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 3' and said there have been no talks over it. "But would love to collaborate with Kartik...We all began together so that will always be a team close to my heart," he added. Divyenndu and Kartik made their debut with 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'.

284.title: India will grow to become $40 trillion economy by 2047: Mukesh Ambani
284.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Tuesday said, "As the Amrit Kaal unfolds, India will witness an unprecedented explosion in economic growth and opportunities." "From a 3 trillion-dollar economy, India will grow to become a 40 trillion-dollar economy by 2047, ranking among the top three economies of the world," Ambani said at the 10th convocation of Pandit Deendayal Energy University.

285.title: Surprised by Congress leaders' praise for Sardar Patel: Amit Shah
285.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that he is surprised that Congress leaders are praising Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and said that they left no stone unturned to insult him. Shah alleged that Congress performed Patel's last rites in an "unceremonious manner". He further said that Congress has started praising Patel only in view of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections.

286.title: Iraqi auditors find embezzlement of $2.5 billion of tax income
286.article_body: Around $2.5 billion (3.7 trillion Iraqi dinars) of the Iraqi government's tax income has been embezzled, Iraqi auditors have found. This development, which was first reported by The Guardian, is being viewed as potentially the biggest corruption scam under ex-Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kahdimi. In Transparency International's clean governance index (2021), Iraq ranked 157th out of 180 countries.

287.title: Sabarimala pilgrims can keep coconuts in flight cabin baggage
287.article_body: The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has allowed Sabarimala pilgrims to carry coconuts in cabin baggage on flights for a limited period of time. Currently, according to rules, coconuts are not permitted in cabin baggage as they are flammable. According to an official, additional security measures and checks have been put in place with regard to this.

288.title: High-ranking Bhutanese monks arrive in India to visit Buddhist sites
288.article_body: A delegation of 24 high-ranking Bhutanese monks arrived in India on Tuesday for a spiritual and academic tour. The monks will meet top Indian officials in Delhi and visit Buddhist holy sites, including Nagarjunakonda in Andhra Pradesh and Buddhavanam in Telangana. The International Buddhist Confederation, which has organised the trip, said the visit will strengthen ties between Bhutan and India.

289.title: SC to hear NIA's plea against bail to Elgar Parishad accused Teltumbde
289.article_body: The Supreme Court agreed to hear the National Investigation Agency's (NIA's) appeal against the bail granted to scholar-activist Anand Teltumbde in the Elgar Parishad case. Taking note of the submissions by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, CJI DY Chandrachud said that the matter will be heard on Friday. Teltumbde was granted bail by the Bombay High Court on November 18.

290.title: Actors now are insecure, concerned about money they take home: Suniel
290.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty, speaking about why it is difficult to make two-hero films nowadays, has said that each actor is insecure about themselves. "Each one talks about the amount of money he wants to take home and not about how much money he wants to put into the product," he further added. Suniel will soon feature in 'Hera Pheri 3'.

291.title: Congress leader's daughter abducted from Jaipur vegetable market
291.article_body: A Congress leader's 21-year-old daughter was allegedly abducted by unidentified persons in Jaipur when she had gone to buy vegetables, police said. The Congress leader said that his daughter was on her scooter and had called him to say that some men were chasing her. The girl's scooter was later found abandoned, while the market's vendors remain clueless, said police.

292.title: Man forces woman to engrave his name on her body with blade in UP
292.article_body: A 25-year-old nursing student was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly forcing a 21-year-old woman to write his name on her private parts with a blade and circulating the video on social media. The accused made obscene videos of the victim holding her at knifepoint. He threatened to kill her and her parents if she refused to marry him, reports said.

293.title: Think big, green & digital 3 mantras to make India green energy leader: Ambani
293.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani shared three mantras to achieve success in the mission of making India a green energy leader. Addressing the convocation of Pandit Deendayal Energy University (PDEU), he said the three mantras were "Think Big", "Think Green" and "Think Digital". Ambani added that green energy "is a goal each one of you should pursue in mission mode".

294.title: Greece rescues boat with hundreds of migrants on board: Coast guard
294.article_body: Greece towed a fishing boat with hundreds of migrants on board to safety after the vessel went adrift off the island of Crete, the Greek Coast Guard informed. According to the Survivors, there were about 400 to 500 people on board, the coast guard said. Two cargo ships, one navy frigate and one tanker also participated in the rescue operation.

295.title: India looks to grow trade with Australia to $45-50 bn in 5 years: Goyal
295.article_body: India expects total bilateral trade with Australia to reach $45-50 billion annually from the current $31 billion over the next 5-6 years, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. The statement came after the announcement of the Australian parliament passing the Free Trade Agreement with India. According to the Commerce Ministry, India's exports to Australia may increase by $10 billion by 2026-27.

296.title: Yuvraj Singh gets notice as his 'unregistered' Goa villa listed as homestay on Airbnb
296.article_body: Yuvraj Singh got a notice from Goa government for listing his Morjim villa and other properties in the state as homestays on Airbnb, without registering them as such with the relevant authorities. Singh has been asked to appear before the Tourism Department to explain why he shouldn't be punished. The default in registration may lead to a ₹1-lakh fine.

297.title: May you break many stumps: Irfan on Umran Malik's 23rd birthday
297.article_body: Wishing India pacer Umran Malik on his 23rd birthday on Tuesday, Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and wrote, "May you break many stumps." Ex-India pacer Munaf Patel tweeted, "Happy birthday champ. Live long, wishing all success ahead in life." Robin Uthappa said, "Have a super successful year ahead! Looking forward to watching more of you on the big stage!!"

298.title: Saudi Arabia fans do Ronaldo's 'Siu' celebration after win against Argentina, video viral
298.article_body: A video of Saudi Arabia fans outside the Lusail Stadium doing Cristiano Ronaldo's 'Siu' celebration after Saudi Arabia's 2-1 victory against Argentina in a 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match has gone viral. Saudi Arabia won the match after scoring two goals in the second half. They were trailing 0-1 after the first half.

299.title: Salman Khan's niece Alizeh begins shooting for debut film: Report
299.article_body: Actor Salman Khan's niece Alizeh Agnihotri has reportedly begun shooting for her debut film. As per reports, National Award-winning filmmaker Soumendra Padhi will be directing the film and it will release in 2023. Alizeh is the daughter of Atul and Alvira Agnihotri. Soumendra has worked in projects like 'Budhia Singh: Born to Run' and 'Jamtara'.

300.title: SA20 league brings much-needed rejuvenation to our domestic system: Duminy
300.article_body: Ex-South Africa batter JP Duminy said that the upcoming SA20 league brings much-needed rejuvenation to the country's cricketing domestic system. "The SA20 is an injection into the domestic system which is usually needed in the upliftment...of the cricketing ecosystem," Duminy said. He added, "I think the uniqueness...is...that there are six IPL franchise owners, which is outside of the IPL."

301.title: New bird-like dinosaur fossil with frog remains in stomach discovered in China
301.article_body: A new bird-like dinosaur with the partial skeleton of an ancient frog in the remains of its gut has been unearthed in China. According to researchers, the dinosaur named Daurlong wangi, which lived about 120 million years ago, was a type of mid-sized dromaeosaurid - a group of bird-like predatory dinosaurs. It primarily fed on fish, mammals, and other dinosaurs.

302.title: Iran hits 'terrorist' base in Iraq's Kurdistan Region: Iranian media
302.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards targeted the base of a "separatist terrorist" group in Iraq's autonomous Kurdistan Region with missiles and kamikaze drones on Tuesday, Iran's Tasnim news agency reported. Last week, Iranian rockets and drones hit the headquarters of Iranian Kurdish parties in the region. Tehran accuses Iraq-based Iranian Kurdish groups of fomenting the ongoing unrest in Iran.

303.title: Saudi goalkeeper breaks down after slamming into teammate's head with a flying knee
303.article_body: Saudi Arabia goalkeeper Mohammed Alowais broke down after slamming into his teammate Yasser Alshahrani with a flying knee during their 2022 FIFA World Cup opening match against Argentina. Alshahrani fell down with his head hitting the turf. The match was halted briefly as he received treatment. He was later carried off on stretcher.

304.title: NCLAT stays CCI imposed penalty of ₹169 crore against OYO
304.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Tuesday stayed the penalty of ₹168.88 crore imposed by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) upon OYO. An NCLAT Division Bench, however, directed OYO to deposit 10% of the penalty amount. The CCI had levied the penalty on the hospitality and travel tech firm for alleged anti-competitive practices.

305.title: TN BJP suspends actress Gayathri for 6 months for 'violating party discipline'
305.article_body: BJP Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai on Tuesday announced the suspension of actress Gayathri Raghuramm for six months for "repeatedly violating party discipline and bringing disrepute" to it. Annamalai also barred OBC leader Surya Siva from party events after an audio clip of him in which he was purportedly heard using abusive language against a woman colleague went viral.

306.title: Feel blessed to get my 1st 'Player of the Match' award: India pacer Siraj
306.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Match' against New Zealand in third T20I, India pacer Mohammed Siraj took to Twitter and wrote, "Thank you everyone for the wishes." He added, "Feel blessed to get my first 'Player of the Match' award and contribute to the team's [series] win. Onwards and upwards from here." Siraj posted bowling figures of 4-0-17-4.

307.title: I felt attack is best defence on this wicket: Hardik Pandya
307.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 30(18) against New Zealand, India skipper Hardik Pandya said that he felt attack was the best defence on the pitch at McLean Park on Tuesday. "We know the kind of bowling attacks they (New Zealand) have, it was very important to get those 10-15 runs extra even though we lost a couple of wickets," Pandya said.

308.title: Principal, 3 teachers arrested after Kerala girl sexually assaulted
308.article_body: Kerala Police has arrested a government school teacher from Tamil Nadu for allegedly sexually assaulting a girl student last week. The school's principal and two other teachers were also arrested for not reporting the incident to the police on time. Police have also seized the main accused's car, which he used to evade his arrest after allegedly committing the crime.

309.title: Tim Hortons plans to open around 120 stores in India in 3 years
309.article_body: Canadian restaurant chain Tim Hortons plans to open around 120 stores in India in the next three years at an investment of up to ₹300 crore, the company’s India CEO Navin Gurnaney said. He added that the company will “build the foundation” with 20 new stores in the first year. Gurnaney mentioned that all the stores will be company-owned.

310.title: Kartik Aaryan is so driven and hard-working: 'Freddy' co-star Alaya F
310.article_body: Actress Alaya F, sharing her experience of working with Kartik Aaryan in the upcoming movie 'Freddy', said she learnt a lot from him. "He's so driven and...hard-working," she added. "Seeing him work and working with him validated my core belief that if you're obsessed with your work...nothing can stop you from achieving everything you want and more," Alaya said.

311.title: It is a dream role: Akshay on playing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj
311.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who'll be portraying Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the upcoming film 'Vedat Marathe Veer Daudale Saat', said he was taken aback when he was offered the role. Calling it a "dream role", the actor said, "It comes with a responsibility." "Also, I'll be working with director Mahesh Manjrekar for...first time and it's going to be an experience," said Akshay.

312.title: Govt invites bids for solar manufacturing under ₹19,500-crore PLI scheme
312.article_body: The state-run Solar Energy Corporation of India is seeking bids from solar manufacturers under the second tranche of the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme with a corpus of ₹19,500 crore. The scheme is aimed at achieving manufacturing capacity of Giga Watt (GW) scale in high efficiency solar photovoltaic (PV) modules. The last date for submitting bids is January 11, 2023.

313.title: India-UAE trade to surpass $88 billion this year
313.article_body: India and UAE have projected to surpass bilateral trade worth $88 billion this year. During the five months between April and August of current fiscal year, the bilateral trade stands at $36.82 billion. UAE signed its first-ever Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement agreement with India in February this year. UAE is now India's third largest trading partner, after US & China.

314.title: I was prepared to bowl hard lengths: Siraj on posting 4/17 vs NZ in Napier
314.article_body: India pacer Mohammed Siraj, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' against New Zealand in third T20I in Napier, said the McLean Park wicket wasn't easy to bat. "I was prepared to bowl hard lengths which gave me the rewards...I just executed my plans," he added. Siraj posted bowling figures of 4-0-17-4. Match ended in a tie via DLS method.

315.title: Congress will form govt with full majority: Former Himachal party chief
315.article_body: Ahead of counting of votes in the state, former Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Sukhwinder Singh Sukhu on Monday claimed the party would form its government with a full majority. Himachal Pradesh would reject BJP's Hindutva agenda and elect a Congress government, Sukhu said. He claimed that AICC General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra mobilised the cadres in the state.

316.title: Rat faeces found in midday meal in K'taka school; headmaster demoted
316.article_body: The faeces of rats were found in rice and sambhar served in the midday meal at Government Higher Primary School in Harapanahalli taluk of Karnataka's Vijayanagara district on Monday. Following the incident, the school's headmaster was reportedly demoted to an assistant teacher, and four cooks, who failed to recognise the rat droppings while cooking, were let off with a warning.

317.title: Warm congratulations: PM Modi as Tokayev wins Kazakhstan Prez polls
317.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated Kassym-Jomart Tokayev for winning the Presidential polls in Kazakhstan. "My warm congratulations to President Tokayev," the PM tweeted, adding, "I look forward to continuing working together, to further strengthen our bilateral partnership." Tokayev won the snap elections with 81.31% of the votes and secured himself a second term of seven years.

318.title: Maha declares 1-day paid leave for voters in some border districts for Guj polls
318.article_body: Maharashtra government has declared one-day paid leave in bordering districts like Palghar, Nashik, Nandurbar and Dhule for voters enlisted in Gujarat Assembly elections. The elections will be held on December 1 and December 5. The government has also asked organisations to grant leave or a minimum of two-hour concession in working hours to the workers, employees and officers for elections.

319.title: IFS officer shares pic of homeless man sharing his mattress with stray dogs
319.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Susanta Nanda took to Twitter to share a photo that shows a homeless man sleeping with several dogs. He can be seen sleeping on the pavement on his tiny mattress. "Our heart has to be large enough to accommodate this big world," the photo caption reads.

320.title: Move Koshyari out, appoint new Guv: Cong amid Guv's remarks on Shivaji
320.article_body: Congress leader Ashok Chavan on Tuesday said Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari should be removed from his office for his remark on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and demanded the appointment of a new governor. "The statement made by the Governor has intensified people's anger," Chavan said. Governor BS Koshyari called Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj an idol of "olden times".

321.title: Condemnable, says BJP after Raj CM calls Shraddha's murder an accident
321.article_body: BJP criticised Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot after he termed Shraddha Walkar's murder by her live-in partner as an "accident". Calling Gehlot's statement "condemnable", BJP leader Satish Poonia said, "It seems that the sentiment of Shraddha murder case has no effect on him. On the contrary, the CM is trying to justify that it was a normal incident."

322.title: Unaccounted income worth ₹100 cr detected after raids on Bihar-based businesses
322.article_body: The Income Tax Department discovered "unaccounted" income worth over ₹100 crore after conducting searches on various Bihar-based business groups dealing in real estate and diamond jewellery. Incriminating documents showing income evasion were also seized, the Department said. Unaccounted cash and jewellery worth over ₹5 crore were seized and 14 bank lockers were sealed during the operation.

323.title: 1-year-old girl gets 115 stitches on face after stray dog bites her in Ghaziabad
323.article_body: A one-year-old girl got 115 stitches during a 36-hour surgery after being attacked by a stray dog in UP's Ghaziabad. The child was attacked by the animal when she playing outside her home on Sunday, reports said. She had multiple injuries on her face, for which small stitches had to be administered, a doctor from MMG District Hospital said.

324.title: Imran Khan sold gold medal he received from India: Pakistan Defence Minister
324.article_body: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan sold a gold medal he received from India during his cricketing years, Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif claimed. Usually, such gifts are either permanently deposited in the Toshakhana or can be bought by the person who received them at a lower price. According to an earlier report, Khan admitted to selling at least four presents.

325.title: CAG initiates probe into BMC contracts worth ₹12,000 cr during pandemic
325.article_body: The Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) has launched a probe into contracts worth ₹12,000 crore awarded by BMC during the COVID-19 pandemic. This comes after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde asked a probe to be conducted into projects undertaken between November 28, 2020 and February 28, 2022. The CAG team held a meeting with the municipal commissioner, a BMC official said.

326.title: Shilpa shares video with Raj Kundra on their 13th wedding anniversary
326.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram and shared a video with her husband Raj Kundra on their 13th wedding anniversary. Along with the video, Shilpa wrote, "13 years, Cookie, whoa! (and not counting). Thank you for sharing this journey with me in this lifetime and making it so beautiful...Happy Anniversary to us, Cookie." They have a son named Viaan.

327.title: Haryana's Mansa Devi temple area to be declared holy complex: CM Khattar
327.article_body: The Haryana government is planning to declare the Mata Mansa Devi temple area a 'holy complex'. "There will be a complete ban on the sale of liquor in an area of about 2.5 km around the temple," CM Manohar Lal Khattar said. He also gave updates about a Sanskrit college and old age home being built on the temple premises.

328.title: Turkey will attack militants with tanks and soldiers: Erdogan
328.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said on Tuesday that Turkey would attack militants with tanks and soldiers "as soon as possible". This comes amid an escalation in retaliatory strikes between Turkish forces and Kurdish militants along the Syrian border. Turkish warplanes struck Kurdish militant bases in Syria and Iraq over the weekend following a blast in Istanbul earlier this month.

329.title: Indians most hurt by tech layoffs in US amid green card wait as long as 195 yrs
329.article_body: Mass layoffs at technology companies in the US have hurt Indians the most, Bloomberg reported. Indians tend to be on temporary visas longer than other foreign groups because of backlogs in getting permanent residency (a green card). A congressional report estimated that Indians filing in 2020 would have to wait as long as 195 years for a green card.

330.title: The best player of the last decade: Ex-Portugal footballer Figo on Messi
330.article_body: Praising Lionel Messi, ex-Portugal footballer Luis Figo said that the Argentina captain is one of the greatest players of all time and the best player of the last decade. The 35-year-old has won the Ballon d'Or a record seven times. Meanwhile, Argentina lost their opening match of FIFA World Cup 2022 against Saudi Arabia 1-2.

331.title: Even Kasab got a fair trial, I'm surely not worse: Satyendar Jain
331.article_body: Jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday, while accusing the Enforcement Directorate (ED) of leaking footage from inside his jail cell, said, "Even [terrorist] Ajmal Kasab got a free and fair trial...I'm surely not worse." "I am defamed every single minute by their act," he added. "I have lost 28 kg in jail...What privilege are they talking about?" Jain asked.

332.title: Ajay Devgn has not approached Salman Khan for 'Bholaa' sequel: Makers
332.article_body: 'Bholaa' makers have refuted the reports stating that actor Ajay Devgn has approached actor Salman Khan for the film's sequel. "Salman and Ajay share a great rapport & friendship, however, Ajay has not approached him for the sequel of 'Bholaa'," a statement by the makers read. 'Bholaa', which will be directed by Ajay, will release on March 30, 2023.

333.title: Weather is something we cannot control: Hardik on 3rd T20I ending in a tie
333.article_body: After India-New Zealand third T20I ended in a tie via DLS method following rain interruption in Napier on Tuesday, India skipper Hardik Pandya said his side would have liked to win the match by playing the full overs. "Weather is something we cannot control," he added. The DLS par score was 75 after nine overs and India were 75/4.

334.title: It was my dream to get selected in Ind women's hockey team: Beauty
334.article_body: After being selected for the Indian women's hockey squad, 19-year-old Beauty Dungdung said that it was her dream to feature in the senior side. "Growing up, I received a lot of support from my family to pursue the sport, especially my father," she said. Beauty was part of India's squad at the junior World Cup in South Africa in 2021.

335.title: 4.5 kg of ganja seized from 2 drug peddlers arrested in Bengaluru
335.article_body: Two people were arrested from Bengaluru's Kamakshipalya for allegedly peddling marijuana and about 4.53 kg of the drug was seized from them. "A case has been registered against the accused under the NDPS Act and...the investigation is going on," said police. Earlier, Bengaluru customs officials had arrested a person at Kempegowda International Airport for allegedly travelling with narcotics.

336.title: Inform us on enforcement of pet shop rules: HC to Delhi govt
336.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has asked the government of the nation capital territory (NCT) to inform it of the "mode and manner" of implementing the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (Pet Shop) Rules, 2018. A bench of justices Amit Sharma and Siddharth Mridul made the enquiry while hearing a PIL seeking regulation of pet shops in compliance of rules.

337.title: Journalist killed, another injured while crossing road in Hyderabad
337.article_body: A 27-year-old journalist was killed and her 26-year-old colleague injured as a speeding car hit the duo while they were crossing the street in Hyderabad's Hayathnagar. "This incident is not a hit-and-run. The car has been seized, and the driver will be taken into custody," said the police. The incident took place around 5:20 in the morning on NH-65.

338.title: 354 people died in road accidents in Noida from Jan-Oct 2022: Police
338.article_body: As many as 354 people died and 680 were injured in road accidents in Gautam Buddh Nagar till October this year, according to police data. In this period, 897 road accidents were recorded in the district, which houses Noida and Greater Noida. The data was shared to observe 'World Remembrance Day', which pays tributes to victims of road mishaps.

339.title: 4 dead, another critical after consuming illicit liquor in Haryana
339.article_body: Four residents of Haryana's Sonipat district died after consuming illicit liquor, police said on Tuesday. Another person, who also consumed the liquor on Monday night, is undergoing treatment at Bhagat Phool Singh Government Medical College for Women and his condition is said to be critical. "We are in the process of registering a case," a police spokesperson said.

340.title: Akshaye was unsure about doing Drishyam 2, said 'It's Ajay's film': Director
340.article_body: Abhishek Pathak, director of Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Drishyam 2', revealed that when he offered a role to Akshaye Khanna, he was "unsure" about doing it. "He asked, 'Why me? It's Ajay sir's film...If you bring me in...something different has to be there otherwise I don't know'," Abhishek added. He further said Akshaye agreed to do the film after reading the screenplay.

341.title: Meta rolls out privacy settings to protect teens from suspicious interactions
341.article_body: Facebook and Instagram parent Meta said that teens, under the age of 16, will now be defaulted into more private settings. Meta is testing ways to protect teens from messaging suspicious adults they aren't connected with. Meta is also working to build a global platform for teens who are worried their intimate images might be shared online without their consent.

342.title: UK launches probe over Apple & Google's 'stranglehold' on mobile browsers
342.article_body: UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has launched an in-depth investigation into the market dominance of Apple and Google's mobile browsers. This comes after a study concluded the companies have the power to "exercise a stranglehold". "Many UK businesses and web developers tell us they feel...they're being held back by restrictions set by Apple and Google," a CMA official said.

343.title: Hyderabad traffic drives not for increasing govt revenue: Police
343.article_body: Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) AV Ranganath said the special traffic drives in Hyderabad are aimed at bringing about a "behavioural change in vehicle users". He further denied claims that strict implementation of rules is being conducted to shore up government revenue. The Commissioner said officials will focus on educating vehicle users from November 28 till the following weekend.

344.title: Cage set up in south Bengaluru to trap leopard that killed calf
344.article_body: The Karnataka Forest Department has put up a cage near the Turahalli forest area in south Bengaluru to catch the leopard that killed a calf on November 19. "The leopard is constantly on the move. We are also tracking its movements," said a range forest officer. The forest officials also advised nearby residents to restrict travelling during the night.

345.title: I goofed up 'Dil...' audition, director gave me 2nd chance: Rupali
345.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly shared a clip from her old TV show 'Dil Hai Ke Manta Nahin' on Instagram and revealed she "goofed up" the TV serial's audition after hearing about the role. "I...pleaded with...director...Rajan Shahi to...give me a second chance...after much pleading he gave in...[I] auditioned for about nine scenes till he was convinced to cast me," she added.

346.title: ISRO scientist loses ₹18 lakh to conman in B'luru college seat scam
346.article_body: A conman cheated a 48-year-old ISRO scientist after promising him a medical seat for his daughter at Bengaluru's BGS Global Institute of Medical Science. The accused, Arun Das, took ₹18 lakh from Chidananda Shivappa Mugdum in the name of donation. While taking the money, Das promised to approach Mugdum later for admission. However, he never returned.

347.title: Farmers' bodies ask govt to lift export ban on wheat at pre-Budget meeting
