347.article_body: Farmers' organisations have asked the government to lift the ban on export of agricultural items like wheat during the pre-budget meeting with the finance ministry. They also demanded to restrict the import of products costing below the minimum support price. Bodies have asked the government to increase the domestic output of local oilseeds like soyabean and sunflower instead of palm.

348.title: Boy with rare 'werewolf syndrome' in MP has hair growing all over body, pic surfaces
348.article_body: A teenager from Madhya Pradesh lives with a rare condition called 'werewolf syndrome'. Lalit Patidar, 17, a student from Nandleta village, was diagnosed with hypertrichosis at the age of six. Hypertrichosis is characterised by an abnormal amount of hair growth all over the body. There is no cure for Lalit's condition.

349.title: What is the new format of T20 World Cup?
349.article_body: The 2024 T20 World Cup will be played in new format wherein 20 participating countries will be divided into four groups of five teams each and the first round will be followed by a Super Eight stage. The top two sides in each of the two Super Eight groups will make the semi-finals, which will be followed by the final.

350.title: Barking dog seized with fear: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's sister on US
350.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's sister, Kim Yo-jong, likened the US to "a barking dog seized with fear". She said that the US was pushing the Korean peninsula towards a new crisis and warned of "the toughest counteraction". She also accused the UNSC of "double standards" after it convened a meeting over Pyongyang's launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

351.title: PhD student sets himself ablaze, hugs woman for rejecting his proposal in Maha
351.article_body: A 30-year-old PhD student died after setting himself ablaze at Government Institute of Science (GIS) in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on Monday afternoon, police said. The deceased, Gajanan Munde, followed a woman and hugged her after setting himself on fire to kill her for rejecting his marriage proposal. The woman sustained 55% burn injuries. Neither of the two people studied at GIS.

352.title: 186 kg of ganja worth ₹9 lakh seized in Tripura, 1 person arrested
352.article_body: Tripura Police, in a joint operation with Assam Rifles, busted a syndicate in which 186 kg of ganja worth approximately ₹9 lakh was seized, officials said on Tuesday. The police said they had registered a case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act at the Sidhai police station. One person has been arrested in this connection.

353.title: One shouldn't get into acting just for money & fame: Pankaj Tripathi
353.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, sharing a piece of advice for young aspiring actors, said that one should not get into acting just for money and fame. "First understand why you want to come here (in the film industry)...understand your love, your needs," he added. "If you work with heart, money will eventually come to you at one point," Pankaj further said.

354.title: Revenue official arrested in Palghar for accepting bribe
354.article_body: A revenue official in Maharashtra's Palghar district was arrested for allegedly demanding and accepting a bribe. The government employee sought ₹30,000 from a man for updating the records of the plot purchased by the latter, an official said. The accused was posted in the district's Wada area and was caught red-handed by the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau officials.

355.title: China resumes streaming S Korean content after 6-year suspension
355.article_body: A Chinese streaming platform has resumed distributing South Korean content after suspending it for nearly six years, a South Korean official said on Tuesday. Notably, earlier this month, Chinese streaming site Tencent began distributing a South Korean film. China blocked Korean content amid tensions over the installation of the US-made THAAD missile defence system in South Korea in 2017.

356.title: Cong will fight to get crop insurance compensation to farmers: Patole
356.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Tuesday said the party will launch a drive to get compensation to farmers from the insurance companies. "The farmers...are going through a big crisis...Farmers are being looted openly by insurance companies with the blessings of the Modi government," Patole said. Crop insurance help desks will be established in all districts and talukas, he added.

357.title: Can't compromise on ideological issues like Savarkar, Hindutva: Raut
357.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that Uddhav Thackeray-led Sena can't compromise on key issues like respect for VD Savarkar and Hindutva. Responding to Rahul Gandhi's comment on Savarkar, which had caused a row, Raut said, "If democracy, freedom and the Constitution are to be safeguarded, then we have to forget our differences and come together."

358.title: Court seeks Tihar jail's response on Satyendar Jain's plea for food
358.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court on Tuesday sought a response from Tihar jail authorities on Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's plea for food, as per his religious beliefs. In his plea, Jain alleged that the jail authorities had stopped providing him with food items like fruits, vegetables, dry fruits and dates, which are necessary as he has been on a religious fast.

359.title: 410 kg marijuana seized from truck in Assam's Karimganj, driver escapes
359.article_body: The Assam police on Monday recovered around 410 kg of marijuana worth ₹41 lakh from a truck in Churaibari area along the Assam-Tripura border, police said. The truck's driver and cleaner allegedly managed to escape before the police intercepted the vehicle. Police are trying to find out the owner of the truck after verifying its registration number from transport authorities.

360.title: India will take up issue with Qatar: Puri on preacher Zakir Naik's World Cup lectures
360.article_body: India will take up the issue of Islamic preacher Zakir Naik being invited for lectures during the 2022 FIFA World Cup, with Qatar, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. Puri further said that the Mumbai-born fugitive evangelist is a Malaysian national. Naik founded the Islamic Research Foundation (IRF) which has been banned in India since 2016.

361.title: AAP plans magic shows, 1,000 'nukkad sabhas' for MCD polls
361.article_body: AAP has planned magic shows, street plays and 1,000 street-corner meetings with star campaigners for the second phase of MCD polls scheduled to take place on December 4. The theme of the second phase of the campaign is 'Kejriwal ki Sarkar, Kejriwal ka Paarshad'. AAP leader Gopal Rai said that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal brought unprecedented development to the city.

362.title: B'luru sees highest growth in office rentals across Asia-Pacific: Report
362.article_body: As per Knight Frank's Asia-Pacific Prime Office Rental Index, Bengaluru posted the highest office rental growth in the Asia-Pacific region in the July-September quarter. Office rent in Bengaluru rose 12.1% year-on-year in the quarter. Jakarta was ranked second, followed by Mumbai. As per the data, rental growth in Bengaluru, Mumbai and Delhi-NCR remained flat compared with the April-June quarter.

363.title: Vedanta approves third interim dividend of ₹17.50 per share
363.article_body: Vedanta on Tuesday announced its third interim dividend of the current fiscal year of ₹17.50 per equity share. The dividend will lead to a total payout of ₹6,505 crore to shareholders. The company's board approved the interim dividend, which translates to 1750% of the face value of every share worth ₹1, according to an exchange filing.

364.title: Pune Police officials suspended, transferred for negligence in murder case
364.article_body: The Pune Police has suspended a sub-inspector and transferred two policemen pending an inquiry into alleged negligence in responding to harassment complaints by a woman who was recently murdered by her harasser. The accused officials have been identified as Vaishali Sool, Shamal Powar and Rajkumar Waghchaware, police said. The deceased was allegedly killed by the suspect, Pratik, on Wednesday.

365.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia misleading people: Alka Lamba on Jain's Tihar video
365.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia of misleading people after a video went viral of AAP leader Satyendar Jain getting massage in Tihar jail. "[Both said] that he is seriously unwell and was receiving physiotherapy…But later...Jail officials...revealed that he was not [a] physiotherapist but an inmate arrested for raping children," said Lamba.

366.title: 'It's the reflex': Veteran who helped disarm gunman at US gay club
366.article_body: An Army veteran who is one of two men being lauded for subduing the gunman during Saturday's mass shooting at an LGBTQ club in Colorado has attributed the apparently heroic act to his military instincts. "It's the reflex: Go! Go to the fire...Stop the activity. Don't let no one (sic) get hurt," US Army veteran Rich Fierro said on Monday.

367.title: UK-India FTA a high priority, negotiations to begin next month: Piyush Goyal
367.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the negotiations for the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and UK are slated to happen next month. "With UK, we are doing a comprehensive deal like the UAE...I assure you that it's a high priority of both countries," Goyal added. The trade between the two countries increased to $17.5 billion in 2021-22.

368.title: What is a leap second and why is it being scrapped?
368.article_body: A leap second is a one-second adjustment occasionally applied to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) either on June 30 or on December 31 to adjust the difference between exact atomic time and Earth's slower rotation. Technology companies, which have to synchronise their systems worldwide to add leap second, protest the practice. Now, governments have decided to scrap leap seconds by 2035.

369.title: I watch 2-3 scenes of Sholay when I face creative block: RRR writer
369.article_body: 'RRR' writer Vijayendra Prasad called himself a fan of Salim Khan and Javed Akhtar. He said that he watches two-three scenes from their film 'Sholay' whenever he faces "a creative block". The writer also spoke about how 1957 film 'Mayabazar' influenced his filmography. "In that film...Not even a single shot is wasted," he added.

370.title: North Goa beaches to have no-take zones to protect environment: Govt
370.article_body: Goa Minister Vishwajit Rane on Tuesday announced 'no-take zones' will be set up at Morjim, Ashvem and Arambol beaches to protect and preserve the environment. "Activities are taking place without permission and destruction of sand dunes is taking place," he tweeted. A no-take zone is an area where extractive activities like fishing, hunting, logging, mining and drilling aren't allowed.

371.title: Messi-led Argentina lose 1-2 against 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in 2022 FIFA WC
371.article_body: Lionel Messi-led Argentina lost 1-2 against 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Tuesday. Messi opened the scoring for Argentina in the 10th minute through a penalty. Forward Saleh Al-Shehri equalised for Saudi Arabia in the 48th minute, with mid-fielder Salem Al Dawsari scoring the winner five minutes later.

372.title: WHO to identify pathogens that could cause future pandemics, 'Disease X' on list
372.article_body: WHO is launching a global scientific process to update the list of priority pathogens. WHO is convening over 300 scientists who will consider evidence on over 25 virus families and bacteria, as well as 'Disease X'. 'Disease X' is included to indicate an unknown pathogen that could cause serious international epidemic. The current list includes COVID-19 and SARS, among others.

373.title: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan gets bail in 2019 hate speech case
373.article_body: A sessions court in UP's Rampur on Tuesday granted bail to Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan in a 2019 hate speech case, which had led to his disqualification from the UP Assembly. Khan, along with two others, was sentenced to three years in jail, following his comments on UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

374.title: TN reporting over 4,500 conjunctivitis cases daily, state govt issues warning
374.article_body: Cases of conjunctivitis, also known as 'Madras Eye', have been rising in Tamil Nadu, with the state reporting over 4,500 cases daily. State Health Minister Ma Subramanian has urged people to avoid self-medication and not use medicines prescribed to other family members. "The medication...is subjective from person to person. If...wrong medicine is used, it...may cause loss of vision," he said.

375.title: Actor Ranjeet's son Jeeva to make his B'wood debut with 'Govinda...'
375.article_body: Veteran actor Ranjeet's son Jeeva is making his Bollywood debut with Vicky Kaushal's upcoming film 'Govinda Naam Mera'. Sharing his look from the film, Ranjeet wished luck to his son and the film's team. Talking about his debut, Jeeva said, "It feels surreal...This journey gave me the rare opportunity to absorb invaluable experience from the best of our industry."

376.title: 'Kantara' becomes second Kannada film to cross ₹400 cr worldwide
376.article_body: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' has become the second Kannada film to cross ₹400 crore mark worldwide. The film has collected ₹400.90 crore worldwide. Over the weekend, it also became the highest-grossing film in Karnataka by overtaking the mark set by Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2'. In North India, 'Kantara' is inching closer to ₹100 crore mark.

377.title: Western Railways' longest skywalk to connect Bandra Suburban Station & Terminus
377.article_body: The Western Railways is all set to construct a new 340-metre-long skywalk that will connect the Bandra Suburban Station and Bandra Terminus in Mumbai. This skywalk will surpass the 314-metre-long skywalk between the Khar Railway Station and Bandra Terminus to become the longest skywalk of the Western Railways. The estimated cost of the project is around ₹32.3 crore.

378.title: Centre may provide ₹1.6 lakh cr additional funds for rural schemes
378.article_body: The Centre is likely to increase its allocation to the Ministry of Rural Development by 18% to ₹1.6 lakh crore to bolster the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MNREGA), Reuters reported citing a government source. Of the budgeted ₹73,000 crore for MNREGA, the Centre has already spent ₹63,260 crore. The rural unemployment rate in October was reportedly 8.04%.

379.title: Jio gains 7.24 lakh users in Sept, Airtel adds 4.12 lakh users: TRAI
379.article_body: Reliance Jio added 7.24 lakh mobile subscribers in September, according to data released by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). India's total mobile subscriber base fell by 36 lakh in September, with Vodafone Idea (VI) facing a decline of 40 lakh in September. Bharti Airtel added 4.12 lakh subscribers in September, the data showed.

380.title: Credit Suisse lays off a third of its China-based investment bankers: Report
380.article_body: Credit Suisse has laid off nearly one-third of its China-based investment banking team and almost half of its research department, Reuters reported citing sources. The report added that over 20 China-based investment bankers were notified about job cuts and 10 employees in the research department were fired. Last month, Credit Suisse announced a capital raise of 4 billion Swiss francs.

381.title: Kim's daughter, seen in public for 1st time, is his second child: Spy agency
381.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's daughter, who was seen in public for the first time recently during a visit to a missile site, is his second child, a South Korean spy agency said. The girl is named Ju Ae and is aged around 10, it told South Korean lawmakers. Kim's wife Ri Sol Ju also observed the missile launch.

382.title: Zerodha fixes glitches after users complain of losses while trading
382.article_body: Zerodha users on Tuesday complained that they were facing issues during the morning trading and were unable to login to their accounts and check, or modify their orders. While Zerodha apologised for the inconvenience and said the glitches were resolved, some users said that orders were still not getting executed. "Trade execution was unaffected," said a company official.

383.title: Europe to be hit hardest by global slowdown: OECD
383.article_body: The global economy should avoid a recession next year but the worst-energy crisis since the 1970s will trigger a sharp slowdown and Europe will be hit the hardest, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) said. The global economic growth is set to slow from 3.1% this year to 2.2% next year before accelerating to 2.7% in 2024, it said.

384.title: Kartik seeks blessings at Siddhivinayak Temple on his b'day, pics surface
384.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, who turned 32 on Tuesday, visited Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai to seek blessings on his birthday, along with his parents. In videos and pictures that have surfaced, he can be seen posing for the photographers outside the temple and clicking pictures with some fans. On the work front, Kartik will next be seen in 'Freddy' and 'Shehzada'.

385.title: BJP uses 'giant mosquito' to protest against rising dengue cases in WB
385.article_body: West Bengal BJP leaders took to the streets of Kolkata to protest against the rising number of dengue cases in the state. In a video, the BJP leaders can be seen protesting against the government using a mosquito net and a giant model of a mosquito. "Health Minister doesn't come to the House (Assembly)," said BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari.

386.title: Telangana Congress leader M Shashidhar Reddy quits the party
386.article_body: Senior Telangana Congress leader and former minister M Shashidhar Reddy on Tuesday announced his resignation from the party. His resignation comes days after the Congress expelled him for six years following his meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Addressing a press conference, Reddy claimed the Congress has not been able to effectively take on TRS in the state.

387.title: Mental health festival 'UDAAN' to be held in Hyderabad on Nov 27
387.article_body: An NGO is set to hold a mental health festival named UDAAN at the Exhibition Grounds in Hyderabad's Nampally on November 27. The festival seeks to tackle mental health-related taboos and focus on how to overcome struggles with the help of art, media and dialogues. It'll comprise of nine events, including 'Circle of Relatability', 'Glee Praxis' and 'Taare Zameen Par'.

388.title: Akshay to join Taapsee, Vaani & Ammy in comedy film Khel Khel Mein: Reports
388.article_body: Akshay Kumar has signed on to star in a comedy film titled 'Khel Khel Mein', as per reports. The upcoming film will also feature Vaani Kapoor, Taapsee Pannu and Ammy Virk in prominent roles, reports added. It will reportedly be directed by filmmaker Mudassar Aziz, who has previously helmed films like 'Happy Bhaag Jayegi' and 'Pati Patni Aur Woh'.

389.title: Hyderabad Police issue traffic advisory for phase 2 of SNDP works
389.article_body: Hyderabad Police issued traffic restrictions ahead of the commencement of the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) phase two works for 3 months. The traffic restrictions will be in place for the construction of the nullah between Rasoolpura to Ramgopalpet police station on Minister Road in Begumpet. Patients going to KIMS Hospital, Minister Road will have to take U-turn at CTO.

390.title: Air India most-punctual airline in Oct with 90.8% punctuality: DGCA
390.article_body: Air India was the most-punctual airline in October with a 90.8% punctuality, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) data showed. The On-Time Performance (OTP) of scheduled domestic airlines is recorded at four metro airports—Bengaluru, Delhi, Hyderabad and Mumbai. The second and third-best punctual airlines were Vistara and AirAsia. These were followed by IndiGo.

391.title: Video shows Japanese World Cup fans cleaning Qatar stadium after match, praised
391.article_body: A video has shown Japanese World Cup tourists cleaning a stadium in Qatar after the opening match between Ecuador and the host country on Sunday. The video was posted on Instagram by Bahraini content creator Omar Farooq, after which it went viral. The Japanese spectators were praised by online users for their cleaning efforts which included collecting littered flags.

392.title: Drug trafficking from across border major concern for Northeast: CM Saha
392.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Tuesday said drug trafficking from across the border is a major concern for the northeast region. He inaugurated the two-day meeting of DGPs and heads of Central Police Organisations (CPOs) of the northeast region. "The two-day meeting…will throw light on the problem and find ways for tackling it effectively," CM Saha stated.

393.title: BJP says actors paid to walk with Rahul Gandhi, Congress rejects claim
393.article_body: The BJP has alleged that the Congress party is paying actors to walk with MP Rahul Gandhi in the Bharat Jodo Yatra and shared an anonymous WhatsApp message to support its claim. Meanwhile, the Congress replied to the unnamed message and said that this shows how desperately the BJP is trying to discredit the yatra.

394.title: It's like national team facing village team: Aakash on TN scoring 506
394.article_body: Talking about Tamil Nadu becoming the first-ever team to breach the 500-run mark in a List A (50-over) match after scoring 506 in a Vijay Hazare Trophy clash against Arunachal Pradesh, commentator Aakash Chopra tweeted, "How's this correct?" "It's like a national team playing against a village team...What purpose does it serve to have this sort [of]...contest?" added Aakash.

395.title: Meta sued in UK over collecting, processing personal data for ads
395.article_body: Human rights campaigner, Tanya O'Carroll, has sued Meta in the UK for "surveillance advertising", the law firm representing her said. O'Carroll alleged that Meta breached UK data laws by not respecting her right to demand Facebook to stop processing her data for advertisements. "This case is...about us all being able to connect with social media on our...terms," said O'Carroll.

396.title: Death toll from Indonesia's earthquake rises to 268; 151 still missing
396.article_body: The death toll from a 5.6-magnitude earthquake that hit Indonesia's West Java province on Monday has risen to 268 as more bodies were found beneath collapsed buildings, the national disaster mitigation agency said. Around 151 people are still missing, it added. Authorities reported that over 300 people were seriously wounded and at least 600 more have suffered minor injuries.

397.title: Delhi excise dept raids birthday party, seizes 65 alcohol bottles
397.article_body: Delhi's excise department arrested a man from Delhi following a raid at a birthday party, where alcohol was being served without a liquor license, officials said on Monday. The Excise Intelligence Bureau (EIB) has also seized over 65 bottles of high-end liquor. The seized liquor bottles included 19 bottles of Chivas Regal and four bottles of Grey Goose Vodka.

398.title: German priest abducted by suspected Islamists in Mali's capital
398.article_body: A German priest was abducted by suspected Islamic extremists in Mali's capital, Bamako, on Sunday. Reverend Hans-Joachim Lohre was preparing to go celebrate Mass in another part of the city when he was kidnapped, Dia Monique Pare, Lohre's colleague, said. The alleged abduction is said to be the first kidnapping of a Westerner in Bamako in more than a decade.

399.title: King Charles to host his 1st state visit for South African President
399.article_body: King Charles will host his first state visit, since his accession to the throne, for South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Tuesday. The late Queen Elizabeth II hosted the last state visit in 2019 for former US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania Trump. Ramaphosa will be officially greeted by Prince and Princess of Wales, William and wife Kate.

400.title: It will be special that Maradona will not be present for WC: Messi
400.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi said late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona not being present for the 2022 FIFA World Cup will make it "special". "It [feels] strange...to [not] see him in the stands," added Messi. This will be the first edition of the FIFA World Cup where Maradona will not be present in the stands to support Argentina.

401.title: Rozgar Mela recruits are my co-travellers in country's development: PM Modi
401.article_body: PM Narendra Modi hailed new recruits hired during the Rozgar Mela as his "colleagues and co-travellers" in the country's development. PM Modi on Tuesday distributed 71,056 appointment letters to new recruits at the Rozgar Mela. Launching an online orientation course for them, Karmayogi Prarambh module, PM Modi urged them to give him feedback after a month, like "colleagues and co-travellers".
